channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US landmine offer to Ukraine throws global treaty into 'crisis': Campaign group
item.description: A US proposal to supply anti-personnel mines to Ukraine has sparked a crisis in the Anti-Personnel Mine Ban Convention, with campaigners urging Ukraine to reject the offer. Ukraine, a signatory of the treaty, is facing pressure to avoid using these mines despite President Zelensky's support. Finland also reassesses its stance on landmines due to Russian threats.

item.title: Putin: Russia will use all weapons at disposal if Ukraine gets N-arms
JD Vance marks Thanksgiving with GOP victory meme, Elon Musk and netizens react
item.description: US vice president-elect JD Vance shared a Thanksgiving message along with a GOP victory meme featuring a map of the US colored red, symbolizing the Republican win. Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded humorously to the meme, while reactions from the public varied.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine's 'decision-making centers' in Kyiv could be next, warns Putin
item.description: Russia launched extensive missile and drone strikes across Ukraine, targeting power plants and causing widespread blackouts as temperatures dropped. President Putin stated the attacks were a retaliation against Ukraine's use of US-supplied missiles. Ukrainian officials reported significant damage, with calls for increased support from Western allies. US President Biden condemned the attacks as outrageous.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: After Donald Trump’s cabinet picks, five Connecticut Democrats receive bomb threats
item.description: Five Democratic Congress members from Connecticut, including Senator Chris Murphy and Representatives Jim Himes, Joe Courtney, John Larson, and Jahana Hayes, received bomb threats at their homes. Police found no explosives at any location. The threats appear to be part of a coordinated effort and came a day after similar threats against Trump’s cabinet picks and appointees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US President Biden urges Donald Trump to ‘rethink’ tariff threats against China, Mexico, and Canada
item.description: US President Joe Biden urges President-elect Donald Trump to reconsider tariffs on Canadian, Mexican, and Chinese goods, labeling them counterproductive. Biden emphasizes maintaining strong ties with neighboring allies, while Trump’s announcements face resistance from Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and cautious acceptance from Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris wearing the same outfit from her 'drunk' rant in Thanksgiving video?
item.description: Kamala Harris released a Thanksgiving video in which she and her husband, Doug Emhoff, shared their gratitude for family, friends, and service members. Social media users noted she wore the same outfit as in a previous video in which she consoled her followers and also released her rant. It looked both the videos were shot back-to-back and the Vice president was apparently seen in the same clothes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Will Hillary Clinton run for president in 2028? Donald Trump Jr reacts
item.description: 77-year-old Hillary Clinton announced a speaking event on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the Clinton Presidential Center in Arkansas. But this announcement turned into the breeding ground of theories that Hillary who would be 81 in 2028 may run in the 2028 presidential race. Social media users even started to speculate who would be Hillary's running mate in 2028.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democrats want their own Joe Rogan: 'But I was on their side...'
item.description: Republicans have their own network of influencers and Joe Rogan has become the most prominent one though Rogan was the last to endorse Donald Trump. In a latest podcast, Joe Rogan said the Democrats want their own Joe Rogan almost forgetting that Joe Rogan was on their side until they drove him away.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Amid divorce rumors, Meghan Markle seeks more time from US authorities to correct this
item.description: Meghan will now fully focus on her career but her jam brand American Riviera Orchard could not procure a trademark because of some issues with the filing. Meghan was given three months to address the errors in the application in August. According to reports, she has now asked for another three months to correct the error in the filing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jimmy Fallon slammed for bizarre fashion choice at Macy's Thanksgiving parade: 'Drinksgiving'
item.description: Jimmy Fallon puzzled fans by wearing sunglasses in rainy weather during his 10th Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade appearance, sparking speculation about a hangover. ​"Sunglasses in the rain is the most Jimmy Fallon that Jimmy can Fallon," one user wrote. Another wrote: "Jimmy Fallon on the least sunny day NYC has ever seen," with picture of a young Jodie Sweetin in Full House wearing oversized yellow glasses
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian-origin neurosurgeon in US fined over $2 million for medicare fraud involving fake surgeries
item.description: Indian-origin neurosurgeon Dr Rajesh Bindal from Houston has been fined over $2 million for fraudulently billing Medicare and FEHBP for surgeries he did not perform. Bindal allegedly taped devices behind patients' ears instead of conducting proper surgeries and, in some cases, allowed unqualified individuals to perform the procedures. Authorities emphasized the importance of accountability in federal healthcare programs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vladimir Putin threatens Ukraine with Oreshnik missile strikes on 'decision-making centres'
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned that Russia might target decision-making centers in Kyiv using its new hypersonic missile, Oreshnik, if Ukraine continues to strike Russian territory with Western-supplied missiles. This follows intensified strikes, including a significant Russian assault on Ukraine, leading to major power outages.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Never going to forget how Facebook...': Laura Loomer enraged as Zuckerberg, Trump dine together
item.description: Far-right activist Laura Loomer criticized Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg for his past actions against Donald Trump, following their dinner at Mar-a-Lago. From suspending Donald Trump's Facebook account to suppressing the Hunter Biden laptop scandal, Laura Loomer pointed out 'Meta scandals' one by one and did not hold herself back. "Why did Mark Zuckerberg ban Donald Trump and his supporters while allowing ISIS to autogenerate accounts?" she posted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Macy's Thanksgiving parade: Mass arrests as anti-Israel protesters block route
item.description: Anti-Israel protesters disrupted Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade in New York City for the second consecutive year Thursday. They halted the Ronald McDonald balloon on the parade route, shouting pro-Palestinian slogans. "Don't celebrate genocide!" the placards that the protesters waved sitting in the parade's path read. The NYPD swiftly arrested numerous protesters and maintained heightened security amid concerns of potential terrorist threats during the event.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump has a new favorite child. And it is not Barron yet
item.description: Donald Trump's eldest son Donald Trump Jr emerged as a loyal enforcer this time while in 2017 he was the central figure of the investigation into the Trump campaign's ties with Russia. During Trump's first term, Don Jr was called reckless but this time, he is the stickler who roped in JD Vance, RFK Jr for his father's campaign and now that all his decisions paid off well, he wants no role in the administration as he prefers to be in the outside.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran general killed in Syria clashes: Media
item.description: A general in Iran's Revolutionary Guards was killed in Syria on Thursday during fighting between Syrian government forces and jihadists, an Iranian news agency reported. "General Kioumars Pourhashemi, one of Iran's senior advisers in Aleppo, was killed in an attack carried out by takfiri terrorist mercenaries," Tasnim news agency reported.

item.title: YouTuber shares video of 'zombie-like people' walking on San Francisco streets; sparks debate
item.description: Indian YouTuber Ishan Sharma shared a video showing alarming scenes of homelessness and drug addiction in San Francisco, calling it the 'most unsafe place'. The footage depicts people in severe distress, sparking reactions online. Elon Musk also highlighted similar issues, describing the city's homeless as 'violent, drug zombies' and noting severe property value decline.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy's son blacklisted from renting LA mansions for parties: 'They would wreck the house'
item.description: Sean Diddy's son Justin Combs has been banned from renting party properties in Los Angeles due to previous incidents of property damage. P Diddy, currently awaiting trial for serious charges including sex trafficking, has had his bail denied again after being caught misusing jail communication privileges. The nature of parties that Diddy's son holds is not known but his lawyer said he did nothing wrong.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Trump wanted to deport Prince Harry
item.description: This followed controversy surrounding Prince Harry’s revelations in his memoir, where he admitted to past drug use, including cocaine, cannabis, and psychedelics. These admissions sparked legal scrutiny, as US immigration law can deem individuals inadmissible based on drug use. Questions have been raised about the accuracy of Prince Harry’s visa application, with some suggesting that any discrepancies could lead to deportation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
